data.title: Death By a Thousand Cuts: An Anthology of Springs Opinions
data.meta_description: This collection of opinion pieces, originally published in The Gainesville Sun, charts 12 years (2008 – 2020) of springs advocacy writing from Florida Springs Institute director, Dr. Robert L. Knight. An Environmental Scientist with more than 40 years documenting and protecting the health of Florida’s springs, Bob has published more than 80 opinion pieces in…
data.text:
$25.00

This collection of opinion pieces, originally published in The Gainesville Sun, charts 12 years (2008 – 2020) of springs advocacy writing from Florida Springs Institute director, Dr. Robert L. Knight. An Environmental Scientist with more than 40 years documenting and protecting the health of Florida’s springs, Bob has published more than 80 opinion pieces in the Gainesville Sun and other Florida print sources. This book is a landmark for Dr. Knight, as well as everyone else who has been a voice for the springs. These essays highlight our steadfast commitment to science-based education and a history of engagement and dedication that continues to rely on the support of our North Florida communities. Celebrate 12 years of springs advocacy and protection with us by ordering your copy today. Be a #VoicefortheSprings!

Rather read as an e-book from your own device? This collection of opinion pieces is now available as an e-book on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08DJ9Q187

Cover photo and foreword by John Moran

Cover design by Kilby Creative

Printed by Alta Systems, Inc.
